snippet.title: Dirt bike rider 'seriously injured'
snippet.content:
Emergency services are at Wallsend after a dirt bike rider was seriously injured. Picture: Dan Irwin
A DIRT bike rider has suffered serious injuries after a crash in bushland at Wallsend on Sunday. A spokesman for the Hunter's Westpac Rescue Helicopter Service said they were called to a section of bush off the Newcastle Link Road about 12.40pm. A doctor and paramedic were winched down into the crash site and the helicopter has landed on a nearby roundabout. The Westpac spokesman said the latest information was the man had been 'seriously injured' in the crash. Emergency services are still on scene. More to come.
